content.en: Protein-ligand prediction: Scientists have been exploring the use of machine learning algorithms to predict various aspects of protein-ligand interactions. For example, a novel scoring function called RF-Score uses non-parametric machine learning to predict protein-ligand binding affinity. Another method uses random forests to predict binding residues and ligand-binding sites. These algorithms show promise in improving our understanding of protein-ligand interactions and could have important implications for drug discovery and development.
content.da: Protein-ligand forudsigelse: Forskere har udforsket brugen af maskinlæringsalgoritmer til at forudsige forskellige aspekter af protein-ligand interaktioner. For eksempel anvender en ny scoringfunktion kaldet RF-Score non-parametrisk maskinlæring til at forudsige protein-ligand bindingsaffinitet. En anden metode bruger random forests til at forudsige bindingsresiduer og ligand-bindingssteder. Disse algoritmer viser lovende resultater i forbedringen af vores forståelse af protein-ligand interaktioner og kan have vigtige implikationer for lægemiddelopdagelse og -udvikling.
